page.title: 02THE HISTORY OF WAULDBY FARM
page.content: The farmhouse of Wauldby Manor Farm was built approximately in 1830. The farm is run by a family who moved in, 14 years ago. They have in their grounds, a Chapel which was also built around the same time as the house. The Chapel has not been used since 1920,yet the farmer's grandson was christened there in 1975. In 1976, with a few friends the farmer's wife cleaned the Chapel out and held a flower festival in aid of the Royal National Lifeboat Institution. The Chapel was the Lady Chapel to Elloughton Church. It used to have a belfry, but the belfry became dangerous and had to be taken down.
